Definition: a type of bird kept on a farm for its eggs or its meat, or the meat of this bird that is cooked and eaten:
Example:
A male chicken is called a cock and a female chicken is called a hen.
We're having roast/fried chicken for dinner.

Definition:
(of a person) not at all brave and too eager to avoid danger, difficulty, or pain
in a way that shows someone is not at all brave and is too eager to avoid danger, difficulty, or pain
Example:
He was too cowardly to give the order.
When they criticize us anonymously they come across as cowardly.
These are not cowardly people, but they are cautious.
We will not retreat or act cowardly

Definition:
a man, woman, or child
used when describing someone's character
Example:
Who was the first person to swim the English Channel?
A meal at the restaurant costs about $70 for two people

Definition:
the regular work that a person does to earn money
a particular piece of work
Example:
a temporary/permanent job
When she left college, she got a job as an editor in a publishing company
It's very difficult trying to bring up two children while doing a full-time job

Definition: to get and keep things of one type such as stamps or coins as a hobby
Example:
She collects dolls
So when did you start collecting antique glass

Definition: a small, round piece of metal, usually silver or copper coloured, that is used as money
a chemical element that is a reddish-brown metal, used especially for making wire and coins
Example:
They mine a lot of copper around these parts
One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well

She wears a lot of bright colours.
What's your favourite colour

Definition: an organization that sells goods or services in order to make money
Example:
He works for a software company/a company that makes software
I work for Duggan and Company
